intro: Zappania echinus, commonly known as the spiny zappania, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and distinctive spiny leaves. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a showy display of white or pale pink petals. Zappania echinus is often found in tropical and subtropical environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
